name: subtitle
description: Explanatory or alternative name by which a scientific result is known.

name: contactperson
description: Only for results with type 'software': Information on the person responsible for providing further information regarding the resource

name: id
description: The OpenAIRE identifiers for this result

name: instance
description: Each instance is one specific materialisation or version of the result. For example, you can have one result with three instance: one is the pre-print, one is the post-print, one is te published version

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value expressed in the scheme (i.e. 10.1000/182)

fields.name: scheme
fields.description: The scheme of the persistent identifier for the result (i.e. doi). If the pid is here it means the information for the pid has been collected from an authority for that pid type (i.e. Crossref/Datacite for doi). The set of authoritative pid is: doi when collected from Crossref or Datacite pmid when collected from EuroPubmed, arxiv when collected from arXiv, handle from the repositories

fields.name: alternateIdentifier
fields.description: All the identifiers other than pids forged by an authorithy for the pid type (i.e. Crossref for DOIs

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value expressed in the scheme

fields.name: scheme
fields.description: The scheme of the identifier. It can be a persistent identifier (i.e. doi). If it is present in the alternate identifiers it means it has not been forged by an authority for that pid. For example we collect metadata from an institutional repository that provides as identifier for the result also the doi

fields.name: url
fields.description: URLs to the instance. They may link to the actual full-text or to the landing page at the hosting source.

fields.name: refereed
fields.description: If this instance has been peer-reviewed or not. Allowed values are peerReviewed, nonPeerReviewed, UNKNOWN (as defined in https://api.openaire.eu/vocabularies/dnet:review_levels)

fields.name: accessright
fields.description: The accessRights for this materialization of the result

fields.name: scheme
fields.description: Scheme of reference for access right code. Always set to COAR access rights vocabulary: http://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/documentation/access_rights/

fields.name: label
fields.description: Label for the access mode

fields.name: code
fields.description: COAR access mode code: http://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/documentation/access_rights/

fields.name: publicationdate
fields.description: Date of the research product

fields.name: type
fields.description: The specific sub-type of this instance (see https://api.openaire.eu/vocabularies/dnet:result_typologies following the links)

name: originalId
description: Identifiers of the record at the original sources

name: dateofcollection
description: When OpenAIRE collected the record the last time

fields.name: label
fields.description: Language label in English

fields.name: code
fields.description: alpha-3/ISO 639-2 code of the language

name: pid
description: Persistent identifiers of the result

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value expressed in the scheme (i.e. 10.1000/182)

fields.name: scheme
fields.description: The scheme of the persistent identifier for the result (i.e. doi). If the pid is here it means the information for the pid has been collected from an authority for that pid type (i.e. Crossref/Datacite for doi). The set of authoritative pid is: doi when collected from Crossref or Datacite pmid when collected from EuroPubmed, arxiv when collected from arXiv, handle from the repositories

name: indicators
description: Indicators computed for this result, for example UsageCount ones

fields.name: impactMeasures
fields.description: The impact measures (i.e. popularity)

fields.name: usageCounts
fields.description: The usage counts (i.e. downloads)

name: maintitle
description: A name or title by which a scientific result is known. May be the title of a publication, of a dataset or the name of a piece of software.

name: tool
description: Only for results with type 'other': tool useful for the interpretation and/or re-used of the research product

name: lastupdatetimestamp
description: Timestamp of last update of the record in OpenAIRE

name: contactgroup
description: Only for results with type 'software': Information on the group responsible for providing further information regarding the resource

name: bestaccessright
description: The openest of the access rights of this result.

fields.name: scheme
fields.description: Scheme of reference for access right code. Always set to COAR access rights vocabulary: http://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/documentation/access_rights/

fields.name: label
fields.description: Label for the access mode

fields.name: code
fields.description: COAR access mode code: http://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/documentation/access_rights/

name: contributor
description: Contributors for the result

name: source
description: See definition of Dublin Core field dc:source

name: type
description: Type of the result: one of 'publication', 'dataset', 'software', 'other' (see also https://api.openaire.eu/vocabularies/dnet:result_typologies)

name: country
description: The list of countries associated to this result

fields.name: label
fields.description: The label for that code (i.e. Italy)

fields.name: provenance
fields.description: Why this result is associated to the country.

fields.name: code
fields.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code (i.e. IT)

name: subjects
description: Keywords associated to the result

fields.name: provenance
fields.description: Why this subject is associated to the result

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value for the subject in the selected scheme.  When the scheme is 'keyword', it means that the subject is free-text (i.e. not a term from a controlled vocabulary).

fields.name: scheme
fields.description: OpenAIRE subject classification scheme (https://api.openaire.eu/vocabularies/dnet:subject_classification_typologies).

name: publisher
description: The name of the entity that holds, archives, publishes prints, distributes, releases, issues, or produces the resource.

name: publicationdate
description: Main date of the research product: typically the publication or issued date. In case of a research result with different versions with different dates, the date of the result is selected as the most frequent well-formatted date. If not available, then the most recent and complete date among those that are well-formatted. For statistics, the year is extracted and the result is counted only among the result of that year. Example: Pre-print date: 2019-02-03, Article date provided by repository: 2020-02, Article date provided by Crossref: 2020, OpenAIRE will set as date 2019-02-03, because it’s the most recent among the complete and well-formed dates. If then the repository updates the metadata and set a complete date (e.g. 2020-02-12), then this will be the new date for the result because it becomes the most recent most complete date. However, if OpenAIRE then collects the pre-print from another repository with date 2019-02-03, then this will be the “winning date” because it becomes the most frequent well-formatted date.

name: embargoenddate
description: Date when the embargo ends and this result turns Open Access

fields.name: pid
fields.description: The author's persistent identifiers

fields.name: provenance
fields.description: The reason why the pid was associated to the author

fields.name: value
fields.description: The author's pid value in that scheme (i.e. 0000-1111-2222-3333)

fields.name: scheme
fields.description: The author's pid scheme.  OpenAIRE currently supports 'ORCID'
